name: Vienna Malt (Gambrinus)
notes: Higher kilning temperatures give this Vienna malt its deep golden color and strong malt flavor.

name: Pale Malt, 2 row (Gambrinus)
notes: Gambrinus brewers pale malt, suitable for use as a base for many beers.

name: Pilsner (2 row) (Gambrinus)
notes: Processed from the finest Canadian two-row available, this very low protein base malt may be used in all types of European style beers.

name: Wheat Malt (Gambrinus)
notes: Processed from the finest Canadian wheat available, this wheat malt may be used in wheat beers of all types.

name: Organic Pilsner (Gambrinus)
notes: Organic Pilsner malt from Gambrunus suitable for many Continental beer styles.

name: Gladfield Ale Malt
notes: Gladfield Ale malt has very similar attributes to the Pilsner malt but only winter grown English bread 2 row varieties are used. The malt is fully modified through a traditional long cool germination. This is a highly friable malt but again the soluble nitrogen ratios are kept relatively low to enhance mouth feel and head retention. The kilning regime gives a nice toasty character with enhanced maltiness for dark ales. This can be toned down for a cleaner malt profile for a lighter hoppy pale ale by adding small amounts of Pilsner malt. A single step mash of between 66° and 68°C is sufficient to avoid any lautering problems and obtain good extract however multi step mashes may improve extract potential and improve stability in the bottle. Mash pH should be adjusted correctly to achieve brew house efficiency.

name: Gladfield American Ale Malt
notes: Gladfield’s American Ale malt is our answer for brewers who have found that our regular Ale malt will add too much of a malty and toasted flavour profile to certain beer styles. This malt starts as all our other base malts do with our traditional long cool germination period. What separates it from our standard Ale malt is a newly developed a kilning recipe that favours colour formation typical to an Ale malt but with a clean malt profile and without the extra toasted flavours. This malt has been a favourite for producing popular hop-forward American style beers for which it was named.

name: Gladfield Aurora Malt
notes: Aurora has been developed to produce rich bready, fruit cake aroma and deep red colour. It has a long traditional germination process to create complex sugars and amino acids which react during a careful kilning regime. The resulting Maillard reaction is responsible for the deep red colour. It is ideal for Dark Ales, Belgium style and high alcohol beers for balance and beer stability. If you want to make that big malty, rich beer then this is a great malt to use along with our Crystals and Red Back.

name: Gladfield Biscuit Malt
notes: Gladfield Biscuit malt is made by gently roasting kilned dried ale malt. The resulting malt is ideal in small amounts for Light/Mild Ales and Bitters to give a dry finish to the beer with out too much colour.

name: Gladfield Brown Malt
notes: Gladfield Brown malt is a stronger version of the biscuit malt but made from green chitted malt. This allows good colour build up with out the astringency from husk damage. This malt will impart a dry biscuity flavour to the beer along with nice amber colour. Ideal in Porters, Stouts, Dark Ales or Dunkels in carful amounts.

name: Gladfield Dark Chocolate Malt
notes: Gladfield Chocolate malt is dark in colour and light on astringency due to a unique roasting technique. It has lovely coffee/chocolate aromas and is a big hit with Porter and Stout drinkers! This malt must be used fresh!

name: Gladfield Dark Crystal Malt
notes: All Crystal malts are made in a specialised roasting drum. The green malt used is made from the fattest low nitrogen 2 row barley available. The emphases are on sweetness and evenness of crystallisation. This is achieved by using only the best barley and batch malting small amounts of green malt at a time to feed the roaster. The evenness of colour is achieved by using the latest technology in malt roasting and heat recirculation to avoid scorching. Crystal malts can be used in varying amounts and intensities to an array of beer styles to add colour, flavour, aroma and stability to the beer. It is important to use crystal malts fresh to get the best results.

name: Gladfield Gladiator Malt
notes: Gladiator Malt  is a malt specially developed to provide extra foaming stability, mouth feel and body to the beer with out adding too much colour. Like crystal malts Gladiator has a high amount of unfermentable sugars. These unfermentable sugars will help increase the final gravity and improve beer stability. The final processing of the malt has been done in such a way to reduce colour build up. Because of this Gladiator has proved very popular for use in a wide range of beer styles.

name: Gladfield Lager Light
notes: Lager light is made especially for brewing an all malt lager where a light colour is desirable. It can also be used alongside Gladfield wheat malt when brewing delicate bright clean wheat beers where low colour formation is important and a clean malt profile required.

name: Gladfield Light Chocolate Malt
notes: Gladfield Light Chocolate Malt is a lighter version of our chocolate malt. Produced in the same way and roasted to a lower temperature and lighter colour. This malt has fantastic roasted and espresso coffee like flavours. A great addition to stouts and porters.

name: Gladfield Light Crystal Malt
notes: All Crystal malts are made in a specialised roasting drum. The green malt used is made from the fattest low nitrogen 2 row barley available. The emphases are on sweetness and evenness of crystallisation. This is achieved by using only the best barley and batch malting small amounts of green malt at a time to feed the roaster. The evenness of colour is achieved by using the latest technology in malt roasting and heat recirculation to avoid scorching. Crystal malts can be used in varying amounts and intensities to an array of beer styles to add colour, flavour, aroma and stability to the beer. It is important to use crystal malts fresh to get the best results.

name: Gladfield Manuka Smoked Malt
notes: We take our top quality New Zealand malt and smoke it over 100% Manuka wood from the West Coast. This malt has a smooth smoke character that is both floral and sweet. Perfect for a Kiwi twist to a Rauchbier or to add something unique to almost any beer style. Use this malt anywhere between 1 and 100% depending on the required smoke level.

name: Gladfield Medium Crystal Malt
notes: All Crystal malts are made in a specialised roasting drum. The green malt used is made from the fattest low nitrogen 2 row barley available. The emphases are on sweetness and evenness of crystallisation. This is achieved by using only the best barley and batch malting small amounts of green malt at a time to feed the roaster. The evenness of colour is achieved by using the latest technology in malt roasting and heat recirculation to avoid scorching. Crystal malts can be used in varying amounts and intensities to an array of beer styles to add colour, flavour, aroma and stability to the beer. It is important to use crystal malts fresh to get the best results.

name: Gladfield Munich Malt
notes: Gladfield Munich malt is germinated similar to the Vienna malt using slightly higher nitrogen barley to create more intense colour through greater maillard reactions. This is achieved with a kilning regime that includes higher levels of moist air recirculation during the early and intermediate stages of the kilning cycle followed by high final curing temperatures. The resulting malt is rich, sweat, toasty and biscuity with a touch of breadiness. This malt is ideal for darker style Lagers or Ales and high alcohol beers.

name: Gladfield Pilsner Malt
notes: Gladfield Pilsener malt is made from 2 row English and European bred barley varieties. Only plump low protein barley is used which allows for higher extract potential and helps eliminate potential protein haze issues in the beer. The plumpness and even germination along with low protein gives highly friable malt and care must be taken not to over crush. Protein modification is kept relatively low with out compromising overall quality of the malt. These attributes' make Gladfield Pilsner malt well suited for craft brewing, the lower protein modification improves mouth feel and head retention. Carefully controlled kilning gives a nice malty character with out too much colour. Gladfield Pilsner malt has sufficient diastatic power to convert the addition of 10-20% coloured malts but it is not designed for large amounts of unmalted adjuncts. It is important that mash pH is controlled properly to obtain the best efficiencies and desired outcomes.

name: Gladfield Red Back Malt
notes: The Red Back Malt  is also a unique malt made by Gladfield. It is prepared by a special process before going into the roaster. It is then roasted in a particular way to create certain Maillard reactions which causes the malt to produce a lovely red hue in the resulting beer without the opalescence that can occur with other similar malts. In other words the wort colour is bright with good clarity but most of all a lovely red colour. It goes well with our Pale Ale and Aurora malt which is a melanoidin malt.

name: Gladfield Roasted Wheat
notes: Our Roasted Wheat is produced by roasting unmalted wheat. It is a great way to get those roasted coffee and chocolate flavours without the extra bitterness that comes from roasted barley or chocolate malt. The wheat malt, lacking its outer husk, is less susceptible to burning at the higher roasting temperatures which prevents bitter and astringent flavors. This malt is a great addition to any darker beer style.

name: Gladfield Shepherds Delight Malt
notes: Shepherds Delight is what we would consider a stepped up version of our Aurora malt. It has intense bready, toasted and kola flavour with a lingering fruity sweetness. This malt should be used sparingly to supercharge the maltiness of a beer and will give flavours similar to a decoction mash. Used at too high a concentration could lead to bitterness in the final beer we recommend combining Shepherds Delight with our Vienna malt to give a balancing sweetness. This malt will also give some red highlights to the beers colour. Recommended usage level of 8% Maximum.

name: Gladfield Sour Grapes Malt
notes: Gladfield Sour Grapes malt is designed for pH adjustment in the brew house mash. Sour Grapes is produced through a combination of lactic growth during germination from naturally present bacteria on the grain and a lactic bath prior to kilning grown from the same lactobacillus strains. Recommended usage of between 1% and 5% to achieve target mash pH.

name: Gladfield Supernova Malt
notes: Supernova malt is a new roasted malt from Gladfield that adds nutty, toasted caramel flavours to a beer. It can be used as a replacement for traditional crystal malts to change the flavour characteristics and reduce the beers residual sweetness. We start this malt with Canterbury winter barley and take it through our germination process before it is roasted to develop flavour and colour. This is a great malt to be used in any beer style. We have already seen it used in Pilsners and IPAs between 10 - 25%. We also recommend its use in an Amber Ale up to 25%, it adds a rich depth of malty flavour and really makes this style shine. It goes well in a Porter up to 10-15%, complementing the darker roast malts and adding complexity. Also great for Pale Ales for great toasty caramel flavours that won't overtake the hops, use 5-10%

name: Gladfield Toffee Malt
notes: The Toffee Malt  is a unique malt produced by Gladfield. It is basically a fully caramalised malt that has been roasted at very low temperature. This special roasting cycle produces a very light colour and the resulting malt is toffee like to chew instead of the crystalised popcorn affect of using higher temperatures. The resulting malt is very popular for adding a malty toffee flavour to lighter colured beers and also adds good beer stability, body and mouth feel.

name: Gladfield Vienna Malt
notes: Gladfield Vienna has a kiwi twist but still has the normal characteristics of typical Vienna malt. The germination and kilning allows a sweeter maltier character with out over doing it. It is ideal for darker lagers or Marzen style beers. The Gladfield Vienna goes well with Gladiator and Toffee giving a big white head and lovely golden redy lager for that drinkable session beer.

name: Gladfield Wheat Malt
notes: Gladfield wheat malt like all other Gladfield malts is 100% natural there are no chemicals added to the steep water to accelerate germination or bleach the grain for visual appearances of the malt. Gladfield wheat malt is produced from an old English wheat variety that modifies very well. The resulting malt gives clean light coloured wort.

name: American Roast Millet Malt
notes: Roasted flavors: cashew nut and toasted flavor. Adds that needed punch to Browns and Stouts. Suggested Usage 5-15% A note on Diastatic Power in gluten free malts: Enzymatic activity of gluten free malts is very low. It is possible to convert some starches into fermentable sugars using specialized mash processes, but additional enzymes can also be added to the mash to make up for the low diastatic power of gluten free malts. Gluten free maltsters recommend using Termamyl or SEBAmyl BAL 100 in conjunction with SEBAmyl L. These enzymes can be found along with information on their usage at GlutenFreeHomeBrewing.com glutenfreehomebrewing.com/STORECategory/127/Brewing-Adjuncts.html

notes: Sweet malty aroma is perfect for your Amber, Bock, Dark Lagers, or Octoberfest. notes: Gluten Free Potential 1.037

name: Red Split Lentils
notes: A great source of beta-glucans for beer but contains very little fermentable sugar to the wort. There are at least two ways to use lentils in your gluten free beer. Groundbreaker brewing recommends toasting red lentils at 375 degrees F in a shallow baking pan. Stir every few minutes. While roasting the lentils, they start out tasting and smelling like "raw" green beans. Make sure that all of that raw character is gone from the smell and taste of the lentils. They are done when they smell nutty and are crunchy. It usually takes about 20-25 minutes. Put the lentils in a bag and hang in the kettle. Steep the lentils in the kettle until the wort reaches 160F then remove. Another method is to roast the lentils as described above and then pour them into boiling water. Return the water to a boil and then pour the lentils and boiling water into your mash or boil kettle. You will not remove the lentils from the mash tun or boil kettle.

name: Brewer's Malt, 2-Row, Premium (Great Western)
notes: Premium 2-Row Malt (1.8-2.2°L) Our most popular base malt, perfect for all beer styles, especially American ales and lagers. With moderate protein and enzyme levels and a very clean, smooth finish, our Premium 2-Row Malt is ideal for all-malt beers and for mashes containing moderate levels of adjunct.

name: Crystal 120, 2-Row, (Great Western)
notes: Crystal 120 (115-125°L) As longer roasting times are used to reach colors of 120° ASBC, this crystal malt takes on a fairly intense toffee flavor but still avoids the burnt character of chocolate or black malts.

name: Crystal 15, 2-Row, (Great Western)
notes: Crystal 15 (13-17°L) A lightly roasted two-row malt. The slight caramel flavor and light color provides the brewer with subtlety in the recipe.

name: Crystal 150, 2-Row, (Great Western)
notes: Crystal 150 (145-155°L) Similar to the C120, but with a much more intense flavor and color. May get a hint of the burnt character.

name: Crystal 30, 2-Row, (Great Western)
notes: Crystal 30 (27-33°L) A fully modified and saccharified two-row crystal malt roasted to a target color of 30° ASBC. A versatile malt providing moderate color and caramel flavor.

name: Crystal 40, 2-Row, (Great Western)
notes: Crystal 40 (35-45°L) A fully modified and saccharified two-row crystal malt roasted to a target color of 40° ASBC. A versatile malt providing moderate color and caramel flavor.

name: Crystal 60, 2-Row, (Great Western)
notes: Crystal 60 (55-65°L) Similar to C40 but with a more extensive roasting to a target color of 60° ASBC. Has a more pronounced caramel flavor to coincide with the color.

name: Crystal 75, 2-Row, (Great Western)
notes: Crystal 75 (70-80°L) This two-row malt is roasted to product a color of 75° ASBC. At this roasting level the toffee flavors join the caramel character for a more complex flavor.

name: Pale Ale Malt, Northwestern (Great Western)
notes: Northwest Pale Ale Malt (2.6-3.0°L) A slightly darker base malt than our Premium 2-Row, our Northwest Pale Ale Malt is produced from well-modified, Western-grown 2-Row barley, with a kilning regimen based closely on traditional British Pale Ale malting practices. Contributes a malty complexity to beer flavor and aroma. Excellent in American Pale Ales and American versions of British beer styles.

name: Vienna Malt (Great Western)
notes: Vienna Malt (3-4°L) Processed like Munich malt with a shorter “cure” duration. Color is 3° to 4° ASBC.

name: Black Malt (Hoepfner)
notes: Dark roasted black malt.  Also known by the German name Farbmalt or Farbmalz.  Use in many dark German styles.

name: Caramel Malt Dark (Hoepfner)
notes: Dark German crystal malt.  Adds body, color and flavor.  A typical German crystal malt.  Also sold under the name "Caramel Dunkel".

name: Caramel Malt Light (Hoepfner)
notes: Light crystal malt.  Adds body and aroma.  More dry in flavour than English light crystals.  Also sold under the name "Caramel Hell".

name: Carapils (Hoepfner)
notes: German carapils/carafoam malt.  Used in many beers for better head retention and body.  Can be used up to 25% for low alcohol beers.  Also sold under the German name "Caramel Malz Pils"

name: Melanoidin (Hoepfner)
notes: Aromatic malt from Germany.  Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.

name: Munich Malt (Hoepfner)
notes: Fine munich base malt from Germany.  Creates malty flavor and copper color, used as a base for many German styles.  Enhances flavour, aroma and colour.  Also sold under the German name "Munchner Malz"

name: Pilsner (Hoepfner)
notes: Light pilsner base malt from Germany.  Used in continental pilsners, lagers and pale ales.  Well modified - to avoid lengthy protein rests

name: Smoked Malt (Hoepfner)
notes: Smoked malt used in Rauch beers, Bamburger specials.  Provides strong smoky flavor.  Also sold under the German name "Rauchmalz".

name: Vienna (Hoepfner)
notes: Vienna malt from Germany.  Gives a lovely golden straw wort and unique vienna flavor.  Also sold under the name "Weiner Malz"

name: Wheat Malt, Dark (Hoepfner)
notes: Dark wheat malt base for Dunkels and other dark wheats.  Also sold under the name "Weizenmalz Dunkel" in Germany.

name: Wheat Malt, Light (Hoepfner)
notes: Light wheat base malt.  Use in wheat beers, hefeweizen and Belgian wit styles.  Also sold under the German name "Weizenmalz Hell".

name: Munich Malt (IMC)
notes: Rich, malty Munich base malt.  Suitable for most European styles including festival and bock beers.

name: Pale Malt, Ale (IMC)
notes: Well modified traditional ale malt.  Used as a base malt for pale ales and darker beers.  A very light color ale malt

name: Pilsner (IMC)
notes: Well modified pilsner malt with a good malt profile.  Good attenuation.  Suitable for pilsners and pale lagers and ales.

name: IREKS Spitz Malt
notes: Description / Application: Spitz Malt got its name from the rootlets which protrude slightly due to a reduced germination process. As a result of the low modification, it is suitable for compensating very highly modified malts and for the general enhancement of the foam stability.

name: IREKS Crystal Maple
notes: The lightest of the IREKS crystal malts serves to increase the foam stability and to raise the full-bodied taste of very light beers, without influencing the colour of the beer. Green malt saccharified, caramelized and gently dried on the kiln floor Type of beer: Pilsner, Lager, light beers

name: IREKS Pilsner Malt
notes: Basic malt. This light IREKS brewing malt is suitable for the production of light beers and, in addition, forms the basis for most types of beer. It is characterized by a light colour combined with a high enzymology and high extract contents.

name: IREKS Pilsner Malt Winter
notes: Basic malt. This light IREKS brewing malt is made from the best two-row winter brewing barley. It is suitable for the production of light beers and, in addition, forms the basis for most types of beer. It is characterized by a light colour combined with a high enzymology and high extract contents.

name: IREKS Sour Malt
notes: Description / Application: IREKS Sour Malt contains up to 4,5 % natural lactic acid, the reason why it is very well suited for adjusting the pH value of the mash. This benefits the enzyme activities and thus increases the brewhouse yield.

name: IREKS Wheat Malt light
notes: Description / Application: IREKS Wheat Malt is distinct due to a very high extract content and it hardly influences the colour of the beer. It is suitable as a basis for wheat beers and as a component for top-fermented beers such as Ale, Kölsch, Alt and Multi Cereal Beers. Type of beer: Weizenbiere, Ale, Stout, Porter, Kölsch, Alt, multi cereal beers.

name: IREKS Smoked Malt
notes: Description / Application: To achieve a typical, smoked ham-like taste and aroma profile. Type of beer: Rauchbiere

name: IREKS Pale Ale Malt
notes: Basic malt. Due to its slightly stronger colour in comparison to Pilsner Malt, this IREKS brewing malt gives the beers a more golden hue, such as is present in exponents of the Anglo-Saxon beers.

name: IREKS Vienna Malt
notes: Basic malt. This brewing malt does not only enhance the golden beer colour, it also increases its full-bodied taste. In this way, it is very well suited for Export and Märzen.

name: IREKS Crystal Birch
notes: Description / Application: Should a moderate variation of the beer colour with a simultaneous increase in the full-bodied taste and foam stability be required, then this IREKS crystal malt is strongly  recommended. Manufacturing method: Green malt saccharified, caramelized and roasted in the roasting drum. Due to the drum rotation, an almost complete and homogeneous caramelization is achieved. Type of beer: Pilsner, Lager, Export, Kölsch, Ale.

name: IREKS Wheat Malt dark
notes: Description / Application: IREKS Wheat Malt dark serves to intensify the brown hues and malt aromas in wheat beers and other top-fermented beer specialities. Type of beer: Weizenbiere, Ale, Stout, Porter, Kölsch, Alt, multi cereal beers.

name: IREKS Munich Malt
notes: Basic malt. The ancient form of malt. Dark kiln-dried, malt-aromatic and highly modified, it fulfils the demands of dark beers, but is also suitable as an additive to vary the beer colour and the aroma profile of light beers.

name: IREKS Crystal Oak
notes: Description / Application: This IREKS crystal malt does not only serve to bring subtle brown hues and an enhancement of the foam stability, it introduces, at the same time, subtle hints of caramel. Manufacturing method: Green malt saccharified, caramelized and roasted in the roasting drum. Due to the drum rotation, an almost complete and homogeneous caramelization is achieved. Type of beer: light beers, Export, Festbiere, Märzen.

name: IREKS Mela Red Alder
notes: Due to a special process, stewing, especially many low-molecular substance are formed in this IREKS kiln-dried malt, which are transformed into strong aroma and colour substances during subsequent kilning. For this reason, this malt is particularly suitable for supporting a strong malt aroma and achieving, at the same time, hues of brown which come from the melanoidins formed.

name: IREKS Crystal Mahogany
notes: Description / Application: An IREKS crystal malt which, in addition to pleasant hints of caramel, also introduces reddish colour components. Manufacturing method: Green malt saccharified, caramelized and roasted in the roasting drum. Due to the drum rotation, an almost complete and homogeneous caramelization is achieved. Type of beer: Ale, Stout, Festbiere, amber beers, Rotbiere.

name: IREKS Mela Beech
notes: Due to a special process, stewing, especially many low-molecular substance are formed in this IREKS kiln-dried malt, which are transformed into strong aroma and colour substances during subsequent kilning. For this reason, this malt is particularly suitable for supporting a strong malt aroma and achieving, at the same time, hues of brown which come from the melanoidins formed.

name: IREKS Crystal Rosewood
notes: Description / Application: With these IREKS crystal malt, the colour of the beer can be varied on the one hand, on the other, the foam stability and the full-bodied taste increased. At the same time, strong caramel and subtle roasted aromas are enhanced. Manufacturing method: Green malt saccharified, caramelized and roasted in the roasting drum. Due to the drum rotation, an almost complete and homogeneous caramelization is achieved. Type of beer: Stout, Festbiere, Export, dark beers, Schwarzbiere, Porter.

name: IREKS Crystal Teak
notes: Description / Application: With this IREKS crystal malt, the colour of the beer can be varied on the one hand, on the other, the foam stability and the full-bodied taste increased. At the same time, strong caramel and subtle roasted aromas are enhanced. Manufacturing method: Green malt saccharified, caramelized and roasted in the roasting drum. Due to the drum rotation, an almost complete and homogeneous caramelization is achieved. Type of beer: Stout, Festbiere, Export, dark beers, Schwarzbiere, Porter.

name: IREKS Aroma Malt
notes: The crowning glory of the IREKS special malts. A solidly dark colour and a full aroma turn this malt into an absolute highlight among the special malts. Produced as a kiln-dried malt and not as a roasted malt, this speciality from the IREKS Company is suitable for enhancing the malt aroma and the colour of dark beers without bringing a roasted taste into the beer which could possibly be perceived as being "rough". Over and above, it gives the beers a rugged taste profile, mainly only achieved by use of the decoction method which requires a great deal of time and effort.

name: IREKS Crystal Ebony
notes: Description / Application: This especially dark IREKS crystal malt can also be used in low quantities in the grist for light beers to vary the colour without influencing the taste significantly. Over and above, the level of colour, the full-bodied taste and the foam stability of dark beers can be intensified. Manufacturing method: Green malt saccharified, caramelized and roasted in the roasting drum. Due to the drum rotation, an almost complete and homogeneous caramelization is achieved. Type of beer: dark beers, Bockbiere, Stout, Porter, Schwarzbiere .

name: IREKS Chocolate Malt
notes: Description / Application: This IREKS roasted barley malt does not only give the beers a more intensive level of colour, it also provides impressions reminiscent of dark chocolate or coffee. Type of beer: Schwarzbiere, Porter, Stout, craft beers .

name: IREKS Black Malt
notes: Description / Application: Extremely darkly roasted, this IREKS malt serves to intensify the colour and to achieve a clear roasted taste, which can also be avoided, however, by an especially late addition during mashing. Type of beer: Schwarzbiere, Porter, Stout, craft beers .

name: IREKS Wheat Malt black
notes: Description / Application: An extremely darkly roasted IREKS wheat malt which gives the beer specialities an intensive black colour and a strong, but at the same time full, roasted aroma. As a result of the spelts which are not present in wheat, this malt is distinct due to a less bitter taste. Type of beer: Weizenbiere, Ale, Stout, Porter, Kölsch, Alt, multi cereal beers.

name: Amber Malt (Joe White)
notes: Amber malt. Adjunct for ales up to 25%.  Dry biscuity flavour, subtle ochre colour

name: Caramalt (Joe White)
notes: Crystal-style malt.  Body and head improvement in ales.  Light dextrinious body

name: Chocolate Malt (Joe White)
notes: Chocolate malt.  Adds color and flavor.  Dark bocks (5%), porters and stouts (8%).  Roasted coffee aroma, smoother than RM

name: Crystal (Joe White)
notes: Medium-dark crystal malt.  Used for color and flavor.  Use 5% to 10% for improved colour aroma.  Subtle crystal sweetness.

name: Crystal, Dark (Joe White)
notes: Crystal mark with a deep dark roast.  Adjunct for dark ales, bocks.  Intense crystal flavour

name: Munich, Dark (Joe White)
notes: Dark Munich malt creates malty flavor and color.  Use for darker ales, altbiers.  Dry, slightly roasted intense malt flavour

name: Munich, Light (Joe White)
notes: Light Munich base malt for use in many German styles as well as adjunct for other styles. Marzens, fest beers, bocks and ales. Great malty flavour and aroma.

name: Pale Malt, Traditional Ale (Joe White)
notes: Base malt for all ales and many lagers. Traditional ales, pale ales, darker specials.  Fully modified, full bodied flavour.

name: Pilsner, Malt Craft Export (Joe White)
notes: Highly modified pilsner malt.  For pilsners, lagers, wheat beers.  Fully modified European style pilsner malt

name: Roasted Barley (Joe White)
notes: Dark roasted barley. Dry, slightly astringent roasted flavour. Classic stouts (5%) , background colouring (1%).

name: Roasted Malt (Joe White)
notes: Strong, roasted barley malt.  Stouts and porters.  Dry with rich burnt coffee aroma.  Also sold as "Black Malt"

name: Wheat Malt, Malt Craft (Joe White)
notes: Fully modified wheat malt base suitable for most wheat styles.  Use for traditional wheat beers, ale adjunct (5 to 10%).  Up to 75% may be used in a base malt since this malt is well modified.

name: Wheat, Roasted (Joe White)
notes: Deep roasted wheat malt.  Use in ales, dark wheat beers.  Dryer and softer flavours than roasted barley.

name: Lamonta : Pale American Barley Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: The new standard for brewing pale ales and British specialty beers Lamonta is a remarkable and complex North American craft malt that is golden, sweet, and slightly biscuity.

name: Metolius : Munich-style Barley Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: Imparts a robust and warming malt profile that tastes exactly like a liquid, toasted, graham cracker. With a deep orange & brown color, this malt is the superior choice for brewing traditional styles like Bocks and Munich lagers.

name: Opal 22 : Graham and Cocoa Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: Opal 22 packs in heaps of lightly-toasted, graham and chocolate flavor - just think: S’mores around the campfire minus the marshmallow. Use anywhere from 0-100% to add even more depth to your grain bill.

name: Opal 44 : Toasted Toffee Barley Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: Opal 44 is your next, secret ingredient. Sweet, moderately toasted, with hints of chocolate and raisin; it’s wort is reminiscent of liquified, almonda roca. The average use rate is 2.5 - 5%, but at 44 DP, it can be used up to 100%.

name: Pelton : Pilsner-style Barley Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: The perfect choice for crafting premium lagers, light ales, farmhouse, and wild beers. It produces a complex, slightly grassy, and crisp wort through which our terroir is pronounced…rustic, yet refined.

name: Rimrock : Vienna-style Rye Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: Complex? Spicy? It’s time to toss those over-used and lacking flavor descriptors to the wayside and experience malted rye that is in a class of its own. Rimrock is gently-kilned to a rich orange hue and has a warm bread flavor with notes of graham and honey. This rustic malt has a slight aromatic and herbal character that will remind you of the High Desert frontier.

name: Shaniko : White Wheat Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: The wait is finally over; our white winter wheat “Shaniko” provides your beer a super-rich and creamy cloud of flavor. Perfect for hazy IPAs and wheat beers, Shaniko tastes like cookie dough right off the spoon.

name: Vanora : Vienna-style Barley Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: For use in Vienna, Oktoberfest, and Marzen beers, Vanora is a high-kilned malt that is aromatically-rich, contributing slight walnut flavors and deep, golden hues to your beer.

name: Wickiup : Red Wheat Malt (Mecca Grade)
notes: The missing link in creating classic wheat beers; Wickiup provides a deepy rich, “Cream of Wheat” wort with a hint of bread crust and brown sugar.

name: Mr. Beer Churchill's Nut Brown Ale
Mr. Beer Grand Bohemian Czech Pilsner
Mr. Beer St. Patrick's Irish Stout
Amber Malt (Muntons)
notes: Has a light, biscuity dry flavor and can be used to product Bitter and Mild Ales and sweet Stouts as well as the traditional London Porters that have come back into favor recently. Flavor Contributions: Light, Biscuity Dry Flavor British malts are more modified than American, lending a fuller body.

name: Amber Malt Extract (Muntons)
notes: Made from a blend of pale and crystal malts, this balanced malt extract is ideal for Bitter and Ale style beers.

name: Black Malt (Muntons)
notes: A roasted malt colored to a higher degree than Chocolate Malt in the roasting process. Black Malt has no diastatic activity and no fermentable extract and is simply used to add flavor and color in dark beers such as milds, porters and stouts. Flavor Contributions: Coffee, Intense Bitter, Dry

name: Caramalt (Muntons)
notes: This is a light crystal malt used to add body and sweetness to beer without adding too much color. Flavor Contributions: Adds body and sweetness British malts are more modified than American, lending a fuller body.

name: Caramel/Crystal Malt - 60L (Muntons)
notes: Bursting with flavors of caramel, toffee and biscuit, Munton's crystal 60 has a medium amber-brown color contribution when used as a part of the grist. It will increase residual sweetness as well as improving foam stability, increasing body and adding wonderful aromatics to beer. It can be used whenever crystal malt is called for, and while it creates wonderful British style beers, it also works extremely well in just about any beer style. It is commonly used in pale ales, IPAs, bitter, milds, stouts, porters, and other styles as well.

name: Chocolate Malt (Muntons)
notes: A roasted malt colored to a higher degree than Chocolate Malt in the roasting process. Black Malt has no diastatic activity and no fermentable extract and is simply used to add flavor and color in dark beers such as milds, porters and stouts. Flavor Contributions: Coffee, Intense Bitter, Dry British malts are more modified than American, lending a fuller body.

name: Dark Malt Extract (Muntons)
notes: Made from a blend of pale and crystal malts, this balanced malt extract is ideal for Bitter and Ale style beers.

name: Extra Light Malt Extract (Muntons)
notes: Made from the lightest available lager malt, processed carefully with the gentlest heat necessary to ensure that the resultant extract is the lightest possible from 100% malt.

name: Lager Malt (Muntons)
notes: Lager Malt is kilned at a low temperature to ensure that the malt is a pale color with a delicate flavour but also to preserve a high level of diastatic activity.  Modern lager malts are now fully modified and therefore a simple infusion mash can be used.  The diastatic activity of lager malt means that a good proportion of unmalted grains may safely be included in the mash if required.

name: Light Malt Extract (Muntons)
notes: Made from the lightest available lager malt, processed carefully with the gentlest heat necessary to ensure that the resultant extract is the lightest possible from 100% malt.

name: Maris Otter Extract (Muntons)
notes: Premium base malt from the UK.  Popular for many English styles of beer including ales, pale ales and bitters.

name: Maris Otter Malt (Muntons)
notes: Muntons Maris Otter malt is a 2-row winter variety of barley specially bred for use in the brewing industry. It has a low nitrogen content and  high quality malt characteristics which give beers a lush, full flavor profile. It is generally regarded as having a more rich maltiness than standard American 2-row varieties that have been bred specifically for yield. Plump kernels with good husks for filtration, Maris Otter has a breadiness that goes well in British style ales, but may be used  in any recipe where more malt character and a more rounded flavor are desired.

name: Pale Ale Malt (Muntons)
notes: Muntons English pale malt is a fully modified base malt that can be used in a number of beers. It works best as a base in British and American style ales, but can be used as part or all of the base for other beers as well, since it is easy to work with and has a great flavor. Pale malt is generally more highly kilned than standard 2-row malt, and as a result it is slightly bready and has a richer flavor profile than 2-row. This is a good base to use in a number of beer styles, from lighter pale ales and bitters to darker porters and stouts. Give this a try next time you are putting together a beer that requires a clean yet slightly rich flavor profile.

name: Roasted Barley (Muntons)
notes: Roasted barley is the quintessential grain used in the production of classic dry Irish stouts. Made from unmalted barley that has been deeply roasted, Munton's roasted barley adds a deep roasted flavor and aroma to beers. In addition, it can add a drying quality and roasty bitterness to beers in which it is included as part of the grist. Most notably used in stouts, it can also be used in small proportions in other dark beers such as porters, stouts, milds, dunkelweizens, and browns.

name: Wheat Malt (Muntons)
notes: Red wheat malt.  Wheat malt gives beer a sweet, creamy, malty flavor. Used at high percentages of 40 to 75 percent in wheat beers for distinct wheat character. In smaller proportions of 2 to 10 percent it adds smoothness and foam stability. Useful for almost any English-style ale for head retention & complexity.

name: Wheat Malt Extract (Muntons)
notes: For all traditional wheat beer styles, the Dried Wheat Malt Extract provides body and richness and is essential for brewing German Style Wheat Beers and a small amount aids in head retention for a variety of beer styles. Formulation of Wheat Dried Malt Extract emulates the recipe ratio of many classic German wheat beers.

name: Spraymalt DME - Dark
notes: "A superb addition to any Stout, Porter or Brown Ale. Dark Spraymalt will improve the body, adding extra rich malt flavour and natural colour."

name: Spraymalt DME - Extra Light
notes: "Great for all beer styles. Adds extra body and richness. Especially useful when brewing American Style Beers and Light Lagers."

name: Spraymalt DME - Light
notes: "Great for all beer styles. Adds extra body and richness. Especially useful when brewing lighter beers such as lagers and pilsners."

name: Spraymalt DME - Medium
notes: "Rich malt flavour, ideal for bitters. Boosts the beers’ natural body and results in a more rounded, mellow note to the final brew."

name: Spraymalt DME - Wheat Malt
notes: "Great for all traditional wheat beer styles. Adds extra body and richness. Especially useful when brewing German Style Wheat Beers and as an aid to head retention in normal beer styles."

name: Black Pearl Malt, Dark
notes: Made in Chile. Dehusked black malt. Similar to Carafe and BlackPrinz malts. For adding color without as much flavor impact as Chocolate or Roast malts.

name: Black Pearl Malt, Light
notes: Made in Chile. Dehusked black malt. Similar to Carafe and BlackPrinz malts. For adding color without as much flavor impact as Chocolate or Roast malts.

name: Black Pearl Malt, Medium
notes: Made in Chile. Dehusked black malt. Similar to Carafe and BlackPrinz malts. For adding color without as much flavor impact as Chocolate or Roast malts.

name: Pale Malt, 2-Row (Rahr)
notes: An economical all-purpose base malt. It is made from Harrington and Metcalf barley grown on the western prairies of the US and malted in Minnesota. It is low in total nitrogen, well modified, high in enzymes, and easily converts with a single step infusion mash. It has a light, clean, smooth flavor.

name: Pilsner Malt (Rahr)
notes: A high-quality, economical pilsner malt from Rahr Malting. A bit lighter in color and lower in total protein than Rahr's standard 2-row. Can make up to 100% of the grist for a very pale beer. Great for lagers.

name: Wheat Malt, White (Rahr)
notes: It’s a great base malt for any style wheat beer. It has a doughy, malty, bready flavor and aroma, with white wheat having a slightly milder wheat flavor than red wheat. High protein levels in wheat lend a fullness of body and excellent head retention, but can lead to difficulty sparging. Use small amounts to enhance foam, or use up to 50% of the grist. Recommend incorporating rice hulls to prevent a stuck sparge when using greater than 25%.

name: Pale Ale Malt (Rahr)
notes: An economical domestic base malt for English and American ale styles. Kilned a bit higher than Rahr standard 2-row (3-4°L) for deeper color and flavor.

name: Pale Malt, 6-Row (Rahr)
notes: Optimized for adjunct brewing—its high enzyme content easily converts high percentages of unmalted corn, rice, oats, etc. Six-row is also useful in lautering mashes with huskless grains due to it high husk content.

name: Wheat Malt, Red (Rahr)
notes: This American wheat malt is made from hard red winter wheat and has a slightly fuller, richer taste than normal wheat malt. Use up to 5% for head retention, or up to 50% for a wheat beer.

name: Wheat, Unmalted (Rahr)
notes: This is raw wheat kernels that haven't been malted - perfect for some traditional styles like Wit and Lambic. It adds a ton of mouthfeel and provides a very cloudy finished beer in a Wit or Hefeweizen. A multi-step or decoction mash is recommended, as the wheat has no diastatic power on its own.

name: Munich, Organic (Rhoen)
notes: Organic munich base malt.  Suitable for most German styles.  Adds malty flavor and color to the beer.

name: Pilsner, Organic (Rhoen)
notes: Light Pilsner malt base suitable for most continental lager styles.  Organically grown.

name: Pale Malt - 2 Row (Schreier)
notes: This malt is well modified, clean tasting, and moderate in total protein. An excellent base malt for all beer styles.

name: Pale Malt - 6 Row (Schreier)
notes: The preferred base malt for adjunct-based American lager and wheat beers.

name: Caramel Dark Bohemian Sekado
notes: Caramel Malt dark also (crystal malt) reinforces the typical “caramely” malt aroma of the beer. It gives the beer a significantly darker colour and increases foam stability. The colour of the malt can be determined in line with the wishes of the customer in a range of ±10%.

name: Caramel Light Bohemian Sekado
notes: Caramel Malt light reinforces the typical “caramely” malt aroma of the beer. It gives the beer a darker colour and increases froth stability. In addition it strengthens the full-bodied character of the beer. The malt is malted, sugared and finally gently roasted using a special process.

name: Munich Bohemian Sekado
notes: Munich malt, like Vienna malt, is kilned at high temperatures to emphasize the production of melanoidins. Munich malt will reinforce color it gives an amber color to the beer. To enhance body and aroma of dark beers, such as Pilsner and Bavarian Dark. Based on its strong flavor and the characteristic color, this malt is mainly used for producing dark beers. Golden orange hue with an intensly malty flavor.

name: Pilsen Bohemian Sekado
notes: Standard pilsen malt produced from selected varieties of the spring barley. the standard base for producing Pilsner and Lager type beers. Excellent in many lighter styles such as Pilsner and Lagers. Base for authentic “Czech beer style” such as Bohemian Pilsner.

name: Roasted Bohemian Sekado
notes: Roasted malt gives the beer greater depth of colour and adds fine nuances of chocolate or coffee aromas. The malt flavour is also emphasised. It’s imparts an astringent, smoky flavour and as well as Porter it is used in many dark beers and stouts. For production of dark Munich beers and in baking industry as well. Black Malt with a standard colour of 1300° EBC is obviously of primary use for its colouring value. It is historically the key ingredient in Porter and enjoying a revival in many breweries, as a distinctive and flavoursome speciality beer.

name: Vienna Bohemian Sekado
notes: Vienna Malt deepens the light and brilliant colour of the beer and creates a pleasant, full-bodied taste. Selected brewing barley is used to produce the malt and manufactured according to a special malting process. This malt will reinforce the color and aroma of all beer styles. Is most frequently used in the production of European style golden brown lagers and also and for all Vienna Beer Style, particularly Eastern European and German style beers, and brings out a pleasant malty taste.

name: Wheat Bohemian Sekado
notes: Creamy sweet, malty, charakteristic wheat flour flavor, intensified wheat malt aroma and taste. Base for production of wheat beers, added during the production of both barley lager and top fermented beers.

name: Amber Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Perhaps the most versatile of all Simpsons' roasted products, Simpsons' Amber Malt can be used in a wide variety of beers to add biscuity toasty notes and a beautiful brown hue. Its delicate roast flavour makes it suitable for adding toasty notes to all Dark Beers, as well as lighter Ales and Lagers. Amber Malt brings a clean, crisp dryness to balance delicate floral hops and increases foam stability.

name: Aromatic Malt (Simpsons)
notes: The secret weapon in the British Ale Brewer's arsenal, Simpsons' aromatic malt has a slightly higher acidity to balance pH. Its complex sweetness with sour after-notes gives a magnificent mouthfeel. This, combined with intense malty notes and raisin, makes aromatic malt a versatile product that can be used from as little as 5% to give warm honey aromas and up to 50% as a base malt for dark beers to give raisin and plum notes. Brings a beautiful brown depth of colour.

name: Black Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Simpsons' Black Malt is excellent for darkening beer colour without imparting too much astringency or roast characteristics. The flavour is surprisingly neutral with a clean dryness making it an incredibly versatile product.

name: Brown Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Simpsons' Brown Malt imparts a rich coffee aroma ideal for Stouts and Porters. It delivers a smooth mouthfeel as well as increasing foam stability. The hue is a deep mahogany that brings warmth and depth to dark beers. Often a forgotten malt.

name: Caramalt (Simpsons)
notes: Simpson's Caramalt is a chewy, sweet taste of Heaven. It contributes golden hued colour enhacement and flavour enrichment from its mild toffee notes in Lagers and Extra Pale Ales. Due to its low colour, it is incredibly versatile and can be used to enhance almost any Beer style that needs a little sweetnes.

name: Caramalt, Premium English (Simpsons)
notes: Simpson's Premium English Caramalt is their top of the range Cara. Used in light coloured beers, it will impart a deliciously sweet malty flavour without the burnt character that higher colour crystals bring. Excellent for colour adjustment on delicately flavoured lagers and ales it gives a slight colour increase. Also works well in highly hopped beer to balance out bitterness and citrus aromas.

name: Chocolate Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Simpsons' Chocolate Malt gives beer a stunning dark brown colour. Chocolate overtones and hints of coffee bring richness and complexity at higher usages in Stouts and Porters.

name: Crystal, DRC® (Simpsons)
notes: Due to its unique production process, Simpsons' DRC® can be used to substitute darker roasted malts in dark beers where the astringency and bitterness inherent to roast malts is not desired. This means that it can be used at a higher rate in the grist to add complex caramel and dried fruit notes with a beautiful red-brown hue.

name: Crystal, Dark (Simpsons)
notes: With Simpsons' Crystal Dark, we get into the delicious realms of complex toffee and burnt sugar but without the astringency of roasted malt. Their unique roasting process for crystals allows them to produce exceptional uniformity in each batch, to ensure each grain of malt is perfectly crystallized.

name: Crystal, Extra Dark (Simpsons)
notes: The beautiful rich brown of the grain gives an insight to the exquisite dried fruit and burnt sugar flavours that are imparted by this expertly crafted dark crystal. Used in small amounts, this malt will help balance flavour and colour in dark beers whilst enhancing head retention.

name: Crystal, Heritage (Simpsons)
notes: The uniformity and excellent malting characteristics that have ensured Maris Otter has been the favoured barley variety of the British Brewer, also lends itself to ensure exceptionally good crystal malt. Simpsons have hand crafted this heritage barley variety to produce an outstanding medium crystal bringing flavour and depth of colour to Ales and Bitters.

name: Crystal, Light (Simpsons)
notes: Simpson's Crystal Light brings mild caramel and toffee flavours to beers whilst contributing a beautiful golden hue. Its clean, mild sweetness brings depth of flavour to beers where extra body is required, without adding overtly toasted or roasted characters.

name: Crystal, Medium (Simpsons)
notes: Caramel and toffee notes come to the forefront in Simpsons' Crystal Medium. Their expert roasters use their skills to bring you a crystal that adds stunning deep golden and red hues to your beer, whilst imparting deeper caramel notes.

name: Crystal, T50™ (Simpsons)
notes: The secret is in the name - Target 50! Each batch targets 50 Lovibond colour (130EBC). The specification on Crystal T50 was created with one of their most acclaimed clients in mind. With an exceptionally tight consistency - it's fantastic crystal that crunches in the mouth offering. Crystal T50 provides amazing colour and delicate malty flavours to beer.

name: Dextrin Malt (Simpsons)
notes: A handy little tool to keep up your sleeve, Dextrin Malt can be used sparingly to add body, mouthfeel and foam stability to any beer. Particularly useful in very light, hop forward IPAs to balance bitterness. It is great in lower attenuated sweet beers such as Mild and sweet Stout.

name: Imperial Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Simpson's Imperial Malt imparts a full-bodied flavour and biscuit aroma. The warm brown notes it adds to the wort intensify the dept of colour, without compromising enzymic activity.

name: Lager Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Finest Lager Malt is a superb low colour lager malt. Well modified, high extract UK spring two row barley gives high enzymic activity, low colour, low nitrogen and exceptional Brewhouse performance. It can be used to make any style of lager with its clean, light malty taste.

name: Munich Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Simpson's Munich malt brings rich malty flavours and golden hues to light beers. If you are struggling to bring up the mouthfeel in really hoppy keg beers, try adding a generous proportion of Munich to your grist. An excellent base malt for Strong Bitter, Dark Amber Ales, Brown Ales and Milds. It brings intense colour and malty notes without compromising enzymic action. Despite its continental name, this malt provides a fantastic malty base for British Ales and Bitters.

name: Oats, Golden Naked®™ (Simpsons)
notes: This huskless oat crystal malt is quite simply delicious. An exotic ingredient for the adventurous brewer, it brings a subtle nutty flavour. Its creaminess brings mouthfeel and balance to strong, hop forward beers. One taste and we're sure you'll be inspired to start creating a new recipe.

name: Oats, Malted (Simpsons)
notes: Simpsons Malted Oats have large, thick husks which helps with run off. Once you crack it open, the creaminess of the oats releases a silky smoothness which imparts a sumptuous velvety texture to your beer. This fullness allows it to take as many hops as you can throw at it for a juice bomb, providing balance. In more traditional usage, Malted Oats provide the back bone of creaminess in Oatmeal Stouts and Porters, smoothing the astringency that may result from the heavy use of roasted grains and adding a complexity of flavour. Malted Oats is a hugely versatile product that can be added to any beer style to impart a creamy, velvety smooth mouthfeel.

name: Pale Ale Malt, Extra (Simpsons )
notes: Extra Pale Ale Malt is an excellent base malt for Brewers who require a low colour, well modified malt. The plump grains of UK two-row barley ensure uniformity and consistency, as well as good extract and enzymic activity. If you're limited on base malt storage, it doubles as a great light coloured base for both Lagers and Ales.

name: Pale Ale, Finest Maris Otter (Simpsons)
notes: Maris Otter's superior Brewhouse performance is fantastic. The Rolls Royce of malts for the traditional brewer, this legendary heritage barley variety is the Traditional English Bitter base malt. It produces a rich malty flavour with exceptional Brewhouse performance and beer clarity, due to its low nitrogen content and high extract.

name: Pale Ale, Golden Promise®™ (Simpsons)
notes: When you need a high performing well balanced malt to complement your big hops, you won't lose out on body. This gives the biggest base of any malt without adding colour, resulting in exceptional beers.

name: Pale Ale, Low Colour Maris Otter (Simpsons)
notes: If you require a well modified, high performing malt, but with a low colour, look no further than Low Colour Maris Otter. This heritage barley variety is used to produce an exceptional quality base malts, with high extract and enzymic activity and low nitrogen content. It is kilned at a low temperature, making it perfect for Cask IPAs and Light Coloured Ales.

name: Pale Malt, Best (Simpsons)
notes: For the principal ingredient in keg, bottle or cask ales, Simpsons use top quality UK two-row barley to produce a plump, well-modified malt with good extract and enzymic activity. The versatility of this base malt lends itself to balance hoppy beers or provide a robust malty note to a Traditional Bitter or Belgian-style beer.

name: Rye, Malted (Simpsons)
notes: Malted Rye contributes a spicy rye note to beers. It adds a unique flavour to beer giving fullness and mouthfeel. Great used in conjunction with Red Rye Crystal. Rice husks are recommended if using at greater than 20% to aid filtration. As well as using in traditional Rye Beers, Malted Rye is excellent in hoppy Beer styles, complimenting citrus hops with its spice.Styles: Rye IPA and Speciality Beers.

name: Rye, Red Crystal (Simpsons)
notes: Red Rye Crystal imparts a beautiful ruby red hue to beers whilst offering a well-rounded, sweet, malty flavour. Great Autumnal flavour for seasonal beers.

name: Unmalted Roasted Barley (Simpsons)
notes: Roasted Barley is a typical ingredient of dry Irish Stouts. Although the colour specification is very similar to Black Malt, Roasted Barley has an intense coffee/roast flavour, bestowing a deep dark colour with flavours to match.

name: Vienna Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Simpson's Vienna malt enhances the light colour, flavour and aroma of all light beers. Light, bready, malty notes bring body to Light Ales, Best Bitters and Czech Lagers. Use as a base malt for highly hopped IPA and American Ales to provide great balance and depth.

name: Wheat, Malt (Simpsons)
notes: Wheat malt can be added at 5% to most light beers to increase foam stability without affecting haze or flavour. Used up to 70% as a base malt for wheat beer, it imparts a bready flavour and characteristic citrus notes.

name: Alba Pale
notes: Pale has flavor emphasis of biscuit and slightly bready Skagit Alba is a six row winter barley, developed by Dr. Pat Hayes or Oregon State University.  Alba barley has a slightly thicker husk, which contributes a clean, crisp, slightly bitter flavor.  Nutty notes can be noticed in the malt chew, but translate into something more fragrant in finished beer.  Skagit-grown Alba barley exhibits low total protein, typical to the region.  Since Alba tends to produce high levels of Beta Glucan, brewing with this barley requires scrutiny of mill settings and potentially a longer, or step mash.

name: Alba Pilsner
notes: Pilsner has flavor emphasis of grassy and cracker Skagit Alba is a six row winter barley, developed by Dr. Pat Hayes or Oregon State University.  Alba barley has a slightly thicker husk, which contributes a clean, crisp, slightly bitter flavor.  Nutty notes can be noticed in the malt chew, but translate into something more fragrant in finished beer.  Skagit-grown Alba barley exhibits low total protein, typical to the region.  Since Alba tends to produce high levels of Beta Glucan, brewing with this barley requires scrutiny of mill settings and potentially a longer, or step mash.

name: Brumalt
notes: adds a delicate smooth sweet flavor simular to honey with hints of munich malt roast

name: Caramel 15
notes: honey like sweetness with raisiny and fruit leather flavors and aromas.

name: Caramel 30
notes: Notable for its dark honey-like sweetness with very intense raisin and fruit leather notes, this malt imparts dark reddish tones, and can make a strong impact on flavor and color

name: Caramel 5
notes: honey-like sweetness, with dried raisin and fruit leather flavors, coupled with hints of nuts.

name: Copeland Ale
notes: Ale has flavor emphasis of bready Skagit Copeland: Skagit Copeland is a well-known North American two row spring variety, developed at the Crop Development Center in Saskatchewan, CA by Dr. Brian Harvey, with a nod to the Craft Brewers’ practice of ‘All Malt’ brewing.   Skagit Valley Copeland base malts present distinctive regional flavors described as honey graham crackers and freshly baked bread, along with a notably pleasant mouthfeel.   Skagit Copeland’s inherently low proteins ranging 9.0-10.5%, are akin to grains grown in the UK and Germany, and make Skagit Copeland distinctive and more intense than typical Copeland grown in the North American Great Plains.

name: Pilot Pale
notes: Pale has flavor emphasis of biscuit and slightly bready Pilot, one of our UK origin series, is a two row spring malting barley variety.  It was bred for high temperature stable beta amylase, which could result in a beer with improved attenuation levels, particularly with higher-gravity brews. Beta amylase in Pilot base malts remain stable at higher temperatures, and is not denatured as quickly during a single temperature infusion mash between 150 – 160 degrees. Skagit-grown Pilot winter barley exhibits our signature UK low-protein profile, as well as high extract, low levels of Beta Glucans and moderate levels of FAN and diastatic power (DP) – ideal for All Malt brewing. name: Talisman Pale
notes: Pale has flavor emphasis of biscuit and slightly bready Talisman, one of our UK origin series, is a two row winter malting barley variety. It is the latest of the current direct descendants of Maris Otter via the Puffin, Pearl, Flagon genetic pathway.  Skagit-grown Talisman winter barley exhibits our signature UK low-protein profile, as well as high extract, low levels of Beta Glucans and moderate levels of FAN and diastatic power (DP) - ideal for All Malt brewing. Skagit-grown Talisman base malts are well-suited to moderate gravity ales in both English and American style categories.

name: Vienna
notes: Vienna malt is well known for its versatility in both color addition and flavor. Our Vienna showcases a clean toasted flavor, with a hint of caramel, combined with rich, golden color. Can be used as a primary base malt or as a specialty malt.

name: Violetta Pale
notes: Pale has flavor emphasis of biscuit and slightly bready Violetta is a two row blue-aleurone winter two row variety originated in Germany that grows remarkably well in the coastal Pacific Northwest. While maintaining its Euro-style low-protein profile of 9 – 10.5%, Skagit-grown Violetta provides moderate levels of diastatic power (DP), Alpha Amylase and FAN – ideal for All-Malt brewing. Violetta is well-suited to many beer styles, especially the broad range of continental and early-American lagers.

name: Barley, Flaked (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Flaked barley - may be used in single step mash to increase body of beer.  Typically used in stouts and porters for body and head retention.

name: Black Malt (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Malted black barley  adds a strong burnt coffee flavor - suitable for stouts and porters.

name: Caramalt (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Made from green malt - imparts a light malt flavor and slight hue.  Suitable for light ales, lagers.

name: Chocolate Malt (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Dark chocolate malt from the UK.  Adds strong coffee flavor to your beer.

name: Crystal Malt - 60L (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Caramel or crystal malt from Thomas Fawcett.  Adds Toffee caramel flavor.  Improves head retention and body.

name: Crystal Rye Malt (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Crystalized Rye malt - adds a dry liquorice toffee flavor and quite a bit of color to your beer.

name: Crystal Wheat Malt (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Crystalized wheat malt - adds a dry biscuity flavor, and quite a bit of color.

name: Maize, Flaked (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Unmalted corn flaked for use in a single step infusion mash.  Used primarily to add fermentables without substantially changing body.  Use in light bodied ales and lagers.

name: Oats, Malted (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Malted oats - used in stouts and porters to add body and head retention as well as a unique flavor.

name: Pale Malt, Golden Promise (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Floor malted spring barley from the UK.  Suitable base male for all types of ales.

name: Pale Malt, Halcyon (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Floor malted winter barley from the UK, suitable for both lagers and ales.

name: Pale Malt, Maris Otter (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Premium base malt from the UK.  Popular for many English styles of beer including ales, pale ales and bitters.

name: Roasted Barley (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Deep roasted barley - adds the dry bitter flavor characteristic of Irish Stouts.

name: Wheat, Torrified (Thomas Fawcett)
notes: Unmalted wheat torrified for use in a single step infusion.  Typically used for Wits and other wheats where raw unmalted wheat is called for.

name: Badlands Sunset
notes: Our Badlands Sunset is similar to a Pilsner Malt lending a lighter flavor for your beers but a color of 2.4-2.6°L. The malt is produced from high quality North Dakota grown barley and is fully modified and lightly kilned to yield a light flavor to your beer. Badlands Sunset contributes a delicate yet distinctly malty flavor and aroma with notes of honey, making it perfect for all types of beers. This malt is fully capable to be used in 100% of the grain bill.

name: Dakota M3
notes: Dakota M3 is a mix between a Vienna and Munich malt that offers a powerful clean malty-sweet flavor with subtle reminders of Honey, Almonds and Hazelnuts. Dakota is highly modified, and kilned at high temps which provides the one of a kind flavor. This malt has a Lovibond of 2.4° giving a rich golden touch to the wort. The clean crisp taste and lighter color will add a true uniqueness to any beer and can be used up to 100% of the grain bill.

name: Dakota M6
notes: Dakota M6 is similar to a Munich malt it offers a crisp clean malty-sweet flavor with some biscuit and Carmel nodes to it. Dakota M6 is highly modified, and kilned at high temps which provides the one of a kind flavor. This malt has a SRM of 5.9°.  The clean crisp taste of M6 will add a uniqueness to any beer and can be used up to 100% of the grain bill.

name: Denhoff
notes: Denhoff Malt is Two Track Malting’s first specialty grain that will make your beer truly unique and will fill the air with a nutty, roasted, whole grain smell.  When chewing the whole grain you will notice a sweet toastyness, slight caramel notes and a dark chocolate flavored finish.  Denhoff has a Lovibond of 10, giving you rich golden colored wort.  The aroma from the wort is bready, slightly caramel and has notes of roastiness and biscuit.  When tasting the wort you get a pleasant toasty caramel flavor that is bready and has notes of honey.  Denhoff can be used for up to 50% of the grain bill.

name: Okefenokee Pale Malt
notes: Named by our Grandfather Paul Stober for the pond that never seemed to dry out, we are pleased to bring you 2-Row Okefenokee Pale Malt. Our Grandfather wished this swamp land would dry up so he could plant more grain, but even to this day, the pond survives. Okefenokee is a perfect base malt that can be used for multiple brewing recipes, and it also gives you a story to share with your customers.  Fully Modified Plump 2-Row Kernels with a full flavor profile and color of 2.3-2.8°L. Our Okefenokee Pale is a sweet flavorful base malt perfect for a 100% grain bill. It gives a Meltier characteristic with a slight biscuit-like flavor and a touch of nuttiness. When used in a SMaSH brew it will give a clean golden wort with a rich one of a kind flavor.

name: Viking Caramel Pale
notes: Low colored inactive caramel malt

name: Viking Cookie Malt
notes: Cookie Malt is produced by roasting high quality pilsner malt. The amylolytic activity of Cookie Malt is negligible. As its name stands Cookie Malt contributes mild and pleasant roasted cereal flavors and aromas with hints of pop-corn and biscuits.

name: Viking Munich Malt Dark
notes: Diastatic activity low.

name: Viking Red Active Malt
notes: Viking Red Active Malt gives a pure malty, nutty and clean long-lasting flavor together with unique amylase activities for this color level. This is a malt for any brew where red, red-amber color is wanted. Good amylase activity and can be used up to 100% dosage. Lower pH value supporting your brewing process. In many beers, you can use this malt as a base malt.

name: Viking Enzyme Malt
notes: DMSP lewel high, needs good evaporation if used in beer.

name: Viking Red Ale Malt
notes: Aromatic malt recommended for dark beers to enhance colour and aroma. Hue is reddish and Flavor of Red Ale Malt is malty and bitter but also roasted and nutty flavors can be found with long lasting linger. Red Ale Malt is also slightly acidic.

name: Viking Chocolate Light Malt
notes: Aromas and tastes of coffee and chocolate can be found and they are well balancing the overall taste

name: Viking Pale Ale Malt
notes: Malted from 2-row spring barley. Malting parameters chosen to meet high degree of modification. Malt flavor contributes specially to malty, sweet and nutty notes. Somewhat lower amylase activity than with pilsner malt. Gives easy prosessing in single step mashings.

name: Viking Roasted Barley
notes: Roasted barley is produced from malting barley. The enzymatic activity is zero. Fermentable extract is low. Typical flavor is burnt and roasted.

name: Viking Caramel Wheat
notes: Gentle roasting process ensures unique flavor. Roasted wheat malt can be used for many beer to enrich flavor and color.

name: Viking Chocolate Dark Malt
notes: Flavor of Chocolate Dark Malt is burnt, bitter and smoky, but not that intense as with Black malt. Aromas and tastes of coffee and chocolate can be found and they are well balancing the overall taste.

name: Viking Pearled Black Malt
notes: The flavor of Black Pearled Malt is harsh but less bitter than that of black malt or roasted barley. Burnt and smoky flavors are strong.

name: Viking Sahti Malt
notes: Malt for Traditional Sahti brewing. Flavor is strong, round and malty. Hints of slightly roasted nuts and fruits can be found combined with some sweetness. Available only in crushed form.

name: Viking Pilsner Zero Malt
notes: Viking Pilsner Zero Malt is pale malt made from 2- row spring barley, so called null-LOX varieties. Beer brewed from those varieties will have improved taste stability over storage time.

name: Viking Pot Still Rye Malt
notes: Ment for whisky production

name: Viking Smoked Malt, Sweet Cherry wood
Viking Dextrin Malt
notes: Viking Dextrin malt, can be used in grists for ales and lagers to give fullness and sweetness in overall taste supporting good head retention. As Dextrin Malt is light colored with not too overwhelming taste dosage rate can be up to 30%.

name: Viking Delicacy Caramel Rye
notes: Viking Delicacy Caramel Rye is strong in taste. First flavor notes are somewhat bitter and roasted with somewhat lingering sweet and dark caramel like flavor. Brings beautifull reddnes into wort. Available from Finland in Hammer milled powder form and from Poland as a whole kernel.

name: Viking Golden Ale Malt
notes: Strong malty flavor with cookie, sweet and nutty notes. Wort color is pure golden without red hues.

notes: Apricot fruit base for wine, mead, beer and cider.  Add to either primary or secondary fermentation.

name: Blood Orange Puree - Vintner's
notes: Blood Orange fruit base for wine, mead, beer and cider.  Add to either primary or secondary fermentation. The blood orange has a deep red flesh and a rind that has a bright red blush in color. The flavor is stronger and the aroma is more intense than a normal orange but shares the same wonderful citrus flavors. Blood Orange has a distinct, sweet flavor with a hint of raspberry. The blood orange pulp adds a nice texture that compliments the bright flavors.

name: Acidulated (Weyermann)
notes: Used in Germany to lower PH levels without resorting to chemicals.  Lowers mash pH levels, lightens color, improves flavor stability.

name: Caraamber (Weyermann)
notes: Medium colored caramel malt. Bocks, dark ales, red and amber lagers and ales. Improves flavour stability and enhances colour

name: Caraaroma (Weyermann)
notes: Very dark caramel malt with aromatic properties.  Adds deep red color and aroma.  Amber ales, dark lagers, bocks. Substitute for "Belgian Special B" or 120L caramel malts.

name: Carafa I (Weyermann)
notes: Chocolate malt.  Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers.  Adds color and aroma.

name: Carafa II (Weyermann)
notes: Chocolate malt.  Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers.  Adds color and aroma.

name: Carafa III (Weyermann)
notes: Chocolate malt.  Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers.  Adds color and aroma.

name: Carafa Special I (Weyermann)
notes: Chocolate malt.  Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers.  Adds color and aroma.  De-husked, smoother tasting

name: Carafa Special II (Weyermann)
notes: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavor.  Adds body, color, aroma.  Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

name: Carafa Special III (Weyermann)
notes: De-husked chocolate malt for a smoother flavour. Dark version.  Adds color and aroma. Dark beers, Alts, Bockbiers

name: Carafoam (Weyermann)
notes: Carafoam (also called Carapils) adds body and head retention without substantially altering flavor.  Up to 10% for light beers, 40% for mashed beers

name: Carahell (Weyermann)
notes: Light colored caramel malt.  Adds body, color and aroma.  Use up to 30% in low alcohol beers

name: Caramel Rye (Weyermann)
notes: Caramel malt made with a rye base.  Adds aroma, flavor and color.  Used in rye styles.

name: Caramunich I (Weyermann)
notes: German crystal malt.  Adds maltiness, flavor, color and aroma.

name: Caramunich II (Weyermann)
notes: German crystal malt.  Adds maltiness, aroma, color.

name: Caramunich III (Weyermann)
notes: German crystal malt.  Adds maltiness, body, aroma and color.

name: Carared (Weyermann)
notes: Medium crystal malt, adds a body and reddish color.  Red ales and lagers, Scottish ales. Full body and aroma, deep red colour

name: Carawheat (Weyermann)
notes: Used in wheat beers and ales.  A wheat version of crystal malt.  Promotes fuller flavor, wheat malt  aroma and enhanced color.

name: Chocolate Rye (Weyermann)
notes: Roasted malt made with a rye base.  Adds aroma, flavor and color.  Used in rye styles.

name: Chocolate Wheat (Weyermann)
notes: Chocholate malt made with a wheat base.  Adds aroma and color.  Alts and dark wheat beers.

name: Melanoidin (Weyermann)
notes: Red colored malt that improved head retention and stability.  Used in red lagers, ales, dark beers.  Intense red colour and malty aroma.

name: Munich I (Weyermann)
notes: Light Munich malt.  May be used as a base for many German beer styles.  Fest beers, bocks, ales. Enhances malty flavour and aroma

name: Munich II (Weyermann)
notes: Darker Munich Malt.  Used as a base malt in many German beer styles.  Fest beers, bocks and ales.  Enhances malt flavour and aroma

name: Pale Malt (Weyermann)
notes: Pale base malt for all ales and lagers.  Good general purpose malt.

name: Pilsner (Weyermann)
notes: Pilsner base malt for all pilsners, lagers.  Highly modified malt.

name: Rye Malt (Weyermann)
notes: Rye malt for rye style beers.  Up to 50% may be used in some rye styles.  Adds distinctive rye flavor and aroma.

name: Sinamar (Wyermann)
notes: A unique coloring agent in liquid form.  Schwartz beer, colour adjustment.Roast malt beer extract.

name: Smoked Malt (Weyermann)
notes: Smoked flavor and aroma base malt.  Used in smoked ales, lagers and wheat beers, primarily German styles.

name: Vienna Malt (Weyermann)
notes: Vienna base malt - used in many continental beer styles.  Full bodied, golden color.

name: Wheat Malt, Dark (Weyermann)
notes: Darker wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.

name: Wheat Malt, Pale (Weyermann)
notes: Pale wheat malt, used as a base malt in many wheat styles. Wheat beers, Koelsch, Alts.

name: Apples - Gala
